required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Endoloops, Endostaples and Endoclips for Closing the Appendiceal Stump During Laparoscopic Appendectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Endoloops, Endostaples and Endoclips for Closing the Appendiceal Stump During Laparoscopic Appendectomy

brief_summary.textblock: In this randomized control trial the patients with acute appendicitis will be divided in three groups according to the management of the appendiceal stump(Endostapler, Endoloop or Endoclip). Pre-, peri- and postoperative data will be analysed.

detailed_description.textblock: Acute appendicitis is the most common indication for intraabdominal emergency surgery, and appendectomy is one of the most commonly performed procedures in abdominal surgery. Today laparoscopic appendectomy (LA) has the status of a ''Gold Standard'' treatment, and it is accepted as the treatment of choice for acute appendicitis.There are several ways of closing the appendiceal stump.An inadequate closure of the appendiceal stump can lead to morbidity of operated patients. The aim of this study is to assess the efficiency of different closure techniques by focusing on the intraoperative and postoperative complications.The patients will be divided into three groups based on the technique used for appendiceal stump closure, whether it is Endoloop, Endostapler or Endoclip. In the patients included in the study the investigators will analyse demographic data, peroperative laboratory values, clinical data and treatment outcomes. Also, the histopathological findings of the specimens and perioperative and postoperative complications will be analysed.

primary_outcome.description: Number of all complications will be presented in total numbers.
Complications will be presented as a percentage of the all operated patients.

secondary_outcome.description: Duration of symptoms will be measured in hours.
Body temperature will be measured in degrees celsius.
Length of the operations will be presented in minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Closure of the appendiceal stump using Endoloop
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in which this technique was performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Closure of the appendiceal stump using Endoloop
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of the all operated patients in which this technique was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Closure of the appendiceal stump using Endostapler
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in which this technique was performed

secondary_outcome.measure: Closure of the appendiceal stump using Endostapler
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of the all operated patients in which this technique was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Closure of the appendiceal stump using Endoclip
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in which this technique was performed

secondary_outcome.measure: Closure of the appendiceal stump using Endoclip
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of the all operated patients in which this technique was used.
Length of the hospital stay will be presented in days.
Histopathological findings will be graduated in 3 grades - phlegmonous,gangrenous and perforated.

arm_group.description: Patients in which appendiceal stump was ligated using Endoloop
Patients in which appendiceal stump was ligated using Endostapler
Patients in which appendiceal stump was ligated using Endoclip

intervention.intervention_name: Technique used for closing the appendiceal stump
intervention.description: In all patients, laparoscopic appendectomy is performed, only difference is the way of managing appendiceal stump

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with clinically and radiologically(Ultrasound) verified appendicitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients converted from laparoscopy to open surgery

reference.citation: Yaghoubian A, Kaji AH, Lee SL. Laparoscopic versus open appendectomy: outcomes analysis. Am Surg. 2012 Oct;78(10):1083-6.

Rashid A, Nazir S, Kakroo SM, Chalkoo MA, Razvi SA, Wani AA. Laparoscopic interval appendectomy versus open interval appendectomy: a prospective randomized controlled trial. Surg Laparosc Endosc Percutan Tech. 2013 Feb;23(1):93-6. doi: 10.1097/SLE.0b013e318277df6a.
Beldi G, Muggli K, Helbling C, Schlumpf R. Laparoscopic appendectomy using endoloops: a prospective, randomized clinical trial. Surg Endosc. 2004 May;18(5):749-50. Epub 2004 Mar 19.
Beldi G, Vorburger SA, Bruegger LE, Kocher T, Inderbitzin D, Candinas D. Analysis of stapling versus endoloops in appendiceal stump closure. Br J Surg. 2006 Nov;93(11):1390-3.
Wagner M, Aronsky D, Tschudi J, Metzger A, Klaiber C. Laparoscopic stapler appendectomy. A prospective study of 267 consecutive cases. Surg Endosc. 1996 Sep;10(9):895-9.
Safavi A, Langer M, Skarsgard ED. Endoloop versus endostapler closure of the appendiceal stump in pediatric laparoscopic appendectomy. Can J Surg. 2012 Feb;55(1):37-40. doi: 10.1503/cjs.023810.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of the Department of Hepatobilliary surgery
